s: It could be jumping because the wheel is loose, and the goal is to make it tighter. Try scrolling while look closely at the wheel and see if the wheel stays in place whenever you let go, probably a physical problem with the wheel if that's the case. You can also try making the wheel scroll ...

t: Jump rope recommendations : r/jumprope
s: February 2, 2023 - It would be kind of like trying to learn to drive by jumping into a formula 1 car. A beaded rope is much slower, and you can feel where it is as it rotates around you. Wire ropes are really made for speed, most often to help with double-unders. Looking at your form, it's not bad...honestly going that long before a slip up if you are new to this is really good. You are on the right track for sure. Beaded ropes are cheap, if you want to feel the difference pick one up off amazon ...

t: r/jumprope on Reddit: I’m a total beginner. Searching Amazon I see weighted ropes and speed ropes. I just want a jump rope. Recommendations?
s: September 8, 2024 - If you can find a cheap beaded ... wear slowly, and you can use it to learn the basic steps and rhythm. Once you’ve used that for a while, you can move to either heavier or speed ropes. And if you decide jumping isn’t for you, you’re not $100 or more out. If you’re in the US, target used to sell one for about $12. Amazon may have them ...
